hashCharacters.description:
Specify the character set that Rolldown is allowed to use in file hashes.

- `'base64'`: Uses url-safe base64 characters (0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, _). This will produce the shortest hashes.
- `'base36'`: Uses alphanumeric characters (0-9, a-z)
- `'hex'`: Uses hexadecimal characters (0-9, a-f)
hashCharacters.markdownDescription:
Specify the character set that Rolldown is allowed to use in file hashes.

- `'base64'`: Uses url-safe base64 characters (0-9, a-z, A-Z, -, _). This will produce the shortest hashes.
- `'base36'`: Uses alphanumeric characters (0-9, a-z)
- `'hex'`: Uses hexadecimal characters (0-9, a-f)

format.description:
Expected format of generated code.

- `'es'`, `'esm'` and `'module'` are the same format, all stand for ES module.
- `'cjs'` and `'commonjs'` are the same format, all stand for CommonJS module.
- `'iife'` stands for [Immediately Invoked Function Expression](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/IIFE).
- `'umd'` stands for [Universal Module Definition](https://github.com/umdjs/umd).
format.markdownDescription:
Expected format of generated code.

- `'es'`, `'esm'` and `'module'` are the same format, all stand for ES module.
- `'cjs'` and `'commonjs'` are the same format, all stand for CommonJS module.
- `'iife'` stands for [Immediately Invoked Function Expression](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/IIFE).
- `'umd'` stands for [Universal Module Definition](https://github.com/umdjs/umd).

sourcemap.description:
Whether to generate sourcemaps.

- `false`: No sourcemap will be generated.
- `true`: A separate sourcemap file will be generated.
- `'inline'`: The sourcemap will be appended to the output file as a data URL.
- `'hidden'`: A separate sourcemap file will be generated, but the link to the sourcemap (`//# sourceMappingURL` comment) will not be included in the output file.
sourcemap.markdownDescription:
Whether to generate sourcemaps.

- `false`: No sourcemap will be generated.
- `true`: A separate sourcemap file will be generated.
- `'inline'`: The sourcemap will be appended to the output file as a data URL.
- `'hidden'`: A separate sourcemap file will be generated, but the link to the sourcemap (`//# sourceMappingURL` comment) will not be included in the output file.

sourcemapBaseUrl.description:
The base URL for the links to the sourcemap file in the output file.

By default, relative URLs are generated. If this option is set, an absolute URL with that base URL will be generated. This is useful when deploying source maps to a different location than your code, such as a CDN or separate debugging server.
sourcemapBaseUrl.markdownDescription:
The base URL for the links to the sourcemap file in the output file.

By default, relative URLs are generated. If this option is set, an absolute URL with that base URL will be generated. This is useful when deploying source maps to a different location than your code, such as a CDN or separate debugging server.

sourcemapDebugIds.description:
Whether to include [debug IDs](https://github.com/tc39/ecma426/blob/main/proposals/debug-id.md) in the sourcemap.

When `true`, a unique debug ID will be emitted in source and sourcemaps which streamlines identifying sourcemaps across different builds.
sourcemapDebugIds.markdownDescription:
Whether to include [debug IDs](https://github.com/tc39/ecma426/blob/main/proposals/debug-id.md) in the sourcemap.

When `true`, a unique debug ID will be emitted in source and sourcemaps which streamlines identifying sourcemaps across different builds.

sourcemapIgnoreList.description:
Control which source files are included in the sourcemap ignore list.

Files in the ignore list are excluded from debugger stepping and error stack traces.

- `false`: Include no source files in the ignore list
- `true`: Include all source files in the ignore list
- `string`: Files containing this string in their path will be included in the ignore list
- `RegExp`: Files matching this regular expression will be included in the ignore list
- `function`: Custom function to determine if a source should be ignored

:::tip Performance Using static values (`boolean`, `string`, or `RegExp`) is significantly more performant than functions. Calling JavaScript functions from Rust has extremely high overhead, so prefer static patterns when possible. :::
sourcemapIgnoreList.markdownDescription:
Control which source files are included in the sourcemap ignore list.

Files in the ignore list are excluded from debugger stepping and error stack traces.

- `false`: Include no source files in the ignore list
- `true`: Include all source files in the ignore list
- `string`: Files containing this string in their path will be included in the ignore list
- `RegExp`: Files matching this regular expression will be included in the ignore list
- `function`: Custom function to determine if a source should be ignored

:::tip Performance
Using static values (`boolean`, `string`, or `RegExp`) is significantly more performant than functions.
Calling JavaScript functions from Rust has extremely high overhead, so prefer static patterns when possible.
:::

See  {@linkcode  banner output.banner } ,  {@linkcode  intro output.intro }  as well.

extend.description:
Whether to extend the global variable defined by the  {@linkcode  OutputOptions.name name }  option in `umd` or `iife` formats.

When `true`, the global variable will be defined as `global.name = global.name || {}`. When `false`, the global defined by name will be overwritten like `global.name = {}`.
extend.markdownDescription:
Whether to extend the global variable defined by the  {@linkcode  OutputOptions.name name }  option in `umd` or `iife` formats.

When `true`, the global variable will be defined as `global.name = global.name || {}`.
When `false`, the global defined by name will be overwritten like `global.name = {}`.

esModule.description:
Whether to add a `__esModule: true` property when generating exports for non-ES formats.

This property signifies that the exported value is the namespace of an ES module and that the default export of this module corresponds to the `.default` property of the exported object.

- `true`: Always add the property when using named exports mode, which is similar to what other tools do.
- `"if-default-prop"`: Only add the property when using named exports mode and there also is a default export. The subtle difference is that if there is no default export, consumers of the CommonJS version of your library will get all named exports as default export instead of an error or `undefined`.
- `false`: Never add the property even if the default export would become a property `.default`.
esModule.markdownDescription:
Whether to add a `__esModule: true` property when generating exports for non-ES formats.

This property signifies that the exported value is the namespace of an ES module and that the default export of this module corresponds to the `.default` property of the exported object.

- `true`: Always add the property when using named exports mode, which is similar to what other tools do.
- `"if-default-prop"`: Only add the property when using named exports mode and there also is a default export. The subtle difference is that if there is no default export, consumers of the CommonJS version of your library will get all named exports as default export instead of an error or `undefined`.
- `false`: Never add the property even if the default export would become a property `.default`.

assetFileNames.description:
The pattern to use for naming custom emitted assets to include in the build output, or a function that is called per asset to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[extname]`: The file extension of the asset including a leading dot, e.g. `.css`.
- `[ext]`: The file extension without a leading dot, e.g. css.
- `[hash]`: A hash based on the content of the asset. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The file name of the asset excluding any extension.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories.

See also  {@linkcode  chunkFileNames output.chunkFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  entryFileNames output.entryFileNames } .
assetFileNames.markdownDescription:
The pattern to use for naming custom emitted assets to include in the build output, or a function that is called per asset to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[extname]`: The file extension of the asset including a leading dot, e.g. `.css`.
- `[ext]`: The file extension without a leading dot, e.g. css.
- `[hash]`: A hash based on the content of the asset. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The file name of the asset excluding any extension.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories.

See also  {@linkcode  chunkFileNames output.chunkFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  entryFileNames output.entryFileNames } .

entryFileNames.description:
The pattern to use for chunks created from entry points, or a function that is called per entry chunk to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[format]`: The rendering format defined in the output options, e.g. `es` or `cjs`.
- `[hash]`: A hash based only on the content of the final generated chunk, including transformations in `renderChunk` and any referenced file hashes. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The file name (without extension) of the entry point, unless the object form of input was used to define a different name.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories. This pattern will also be used for every file when setting the  {@linkcode  preserveModules output.preserveModules }  option.

See also  {@linkcode  assetFileNames output.assetFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  chunkFileNames output.chunkFileNames } .
entryFileNames.markdownDescription:
The pattern to use for chunks created from entry points, or a function that is called per entry chunk to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[format]`: The rendering format defined in the output options, e.g. `es` or `cjs`.
- `[hash]`: A hash based only on the content of the final generated chunk, including transformations in `renderChunk` and any referenced file hashes. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The file name (without extension) of the entry point, unless the object form of input was used to define a different name.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories. This pattern will also be used for every file when setting the  {@linkcode  preserveModules output.preserveModules }  option.

See also  {@linkcode  assetFileNames output.assetFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  chunkFileNames output.chunkFileNames } .

chunkFileNames.description:
The pattern to use for naming shared chunks created when code-splitting, or a function that is called per chunk to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[format]`: The rendering format defined in the output options, e.g. `es` or `cjs`.
- `[hash]`: A hash based only on the content of the final generated chunk, including transformations in `renderChunk` and any referenced file hashes. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The name of the chunk. This can be explicitly set via the  {@linkcode  codeSplitting output.codeSplitting }  option or when the chunk is created by a plugin via `this.emitFile`. Otherwise, it will be derived from the chunk contents.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories.

See also  {@linkcode  assetFileNames output.assetFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  entryFileNames output.entryFileNames } .
chunkFileNames.markdownDescription:
The pattern to use for naming shared chunks created when code-splitting, or a function that is called per chunk to return such a pattern.

Patterns support the following placeholders:
- `[format]`: The rendering format defined in the output options, e.g. `es` or `cjs`.
- `[hash]`: A hash based only on the content of the final generated chunk, including transformations in `renderChunk` and any referenced file hashes. You can also set a specific hash length via e.g. `[hash:10]`. By default, it will create a base-64 hash. If you need a reduced character set, see  {@linkcode  hashCharacters output.hashCharacters } .
- `[name]`: The name of the chunk. This can be explicitly set via the  {@linkcode  codeSplitting output.codeSplitting }  option or when the chunk is created by a plugin via `this.emitFile`. Otherwise, it will be derived from the chunk contents.

Forward slashes (`/`) can be used to place files in sub-directories.

See also  {@linkcode  assetFileNames output.assetFileNames } ,  {@linkcode  entryFileNames output.entryFileNames } .

- `false`: Disable minification (default)
- `'dce-only'`: Only perform dead code elimination without code compression
- `MinifyOptions`: Fine-grained control over minification settings

globals.description: Specifies `id: variableName` pairs necessary for external imports in `umd` / `iife` bundles.

paths.description:
Maps external module IDs to paths.

Allows customizing the path used when importing external dependencies. This is particularly useful for loading dependencies from CDNs or custom locations.

- Object form: Maps module IDs to their replacement paths
- Function form: Takes a module ID and returns its replacement path

symbols.markdownDescription: Whether to use Symbol.toStringTag for namespace objects.

preset.description:
Allows choosing one of the presets listed above while overriding some options.

```js export default {   output: {     generatedCode: {       preset: 'es2015',       symbols: false     }   } }; ```

profilerNames.description:
Whether to add readable names to internal variables for profiling purposes.

When enabled, generated code will use descriptive variable names that correspond to the original module names, making it easier to profile and debug the bundled code.
profilerNames.markdownDescription:
Whether to add readable names to internal variables for profiling purposes.

generatedCode.description:
Which language features Rolldown can safely use in generated code.

This will not transpile any user code but only change the code Rolldown uses in wrappers and helpers.
generatedCode.markdownDescription:
Which language features Rolldown can safely use in generated code.

This will not transpile any user code but only change the code Rolldown uses in wrappers and helpers.

externalLiveBindings.description:
Whether to generate code to support live bindings for external imports.

With the default value of `true`, Rolldown will generate code to support live bindings for external imports.

When set to `false`, Rolldown will assume that exports from external modules do not change. This will allow Rolldown to generate smaller code. Note that this can cause issues when there are circular dependencies involving an external dependency.
externalLiveBindings.markdownDescription:
Whether to generate code to support live bindings for external imports.

With the default value of `true`, Rolldown will generate code to support live bindings for external imports.

When set to `false`, Rolldown will assume that exports from external modules do not change. This will allow Rolldown to generate smaller code. Note that this can cause issues when there are circular dependencies involving an external dependency.

inlineDynamicImports.description:
Whether to inline dynamic imports instead of creating new chunks to create a single bundle.

This option can be used only when a single input is provided.
inlineDynamicImports.markdownDescription:
Whether to inline dynamic imports instead of creating new chunks to create a single bundle.

This option can be used only when a single input is provided.

dynamicImportInCjs.description:
Whether to keep external dynamic imports as `import(...)` expressions in CommonJS output.

If set to `false`, external dynamic imports will be rewritten to use `require(...)` calls. This may be necessary to support environments that do not support dynamic `import()` in CommonJS modules like old Node.js versions.
dynamicImportInCjs.markdownDescription:
Whether to keep external dynamic imports as `import(...)` expressions in CommonJS output.

If set to `false`, external dynamic imports will be rewritten to use `require(...)` calls.
This may be necessary to support environments that do not support dynamic `import()` in CommonJS modules like old Node.js versions.

includeDependenciesRecursively.description:
By default, each group will also include captured modules' dependencies. This reduces the chance of generating circular chunks.

If you want to disable this behavior, it's recommended to both set
-  {@linkcode  InputOptions.preserveEntrySignatures preserveEntrySignatures } : `false | 'allow-extension'`
- `experimental.strictExecutionOrder`: `true`

to avoid generating invalid chunks.

name.description:
Name of the group. It will be also used as the name of the chunk and replace the `[name]` placeholder in the  {@linkcode  OutputOptions.chunkFileNames output.chunkFileNames }  option.

For example,

```js import { defineConfig } from 'rolldown';

export default defineConfig({   advancedChunks: {     groups: [       {         name: 'libs',         test: /node_modules/,       },     ],   }, }); ``` will create a chunk named `libs-[hash].js` in the end.

It's ok to have the same name for different groups. Rolldown will deduplicate the chunk names if necessary.

#### Dynamic `name()`

If `name` is a function, it will be called with the module id as the argument. The function should return a string or `null`. If it returns `null`, the module will be ignored by this group.

Notice, each returned new name will be treated as a separate group.

For example,

```js import { defineConfig } from 'rolldown';

export default defineConfig({   advancedChunks: {     groups: [       {         name: (moduleId) => moduleId.includes('node_modules') ? 'libs' : 'app',         minSize: 100 * 1024,       },     ],   }, }); ```

:::warning Constraints like `minSize`, `maxSize`, etc. are applied separately for different names returned by the function. :::

test.description:
Controls which modules are captured in this group.

- If `test` is a string, the module whose id contains the string will be captured.
- If `test` is a regular expression, the module whose id matches the regular expression will be captured.
- If `test` is a function, modules for which `test(id)` returns `true` will be captured.
- If `test` is empty, any module will be considered as matched.

:::warning When using regular expression, it's recommended to use `[\\/]` to match the path separator instead of `/` to avoid potential issues on Windows.
-  Recommended: `/node_modules[\\/]react/`
-  Not recommended: `/node_modules/react/` :::
test.markdownDescription:
Controls which modules are captured in this group.

- If `test` is a string, the module whose id contains the string will be captured.
- If `test` is a regular expression, the module whose id matches the regular expression will be captured.
- If `test` is a function, modules for which `test(id)` returns `true` will be captured.
- If `test` is empty, any module will be considered as matched.

:::warning
When using regular expression, it's recommended to use `[\\/]` to match the path separator instead of `/` to avoid potential issues on Windows.
-  Recommended: `/node_modules[\\/]react/`
-  Not recommended: `/node_modules/react/`
:::

priority.description:
Priority of the group. Group with higher priority will be chosen first to match modules and create chunks. When converting the group to a chunk, modules of that group will be removed from other groups.

If two groups have the same priority, the group whose index is smaller will be chosen.
priority.markdownDescription:

minSize.description: Minimum size in bytes of the desired chunk. If the accumulated size of the captured modules by this group is smaller than this value, it will be ignored. Modules in this group will fall back to the `automatic chunking` if they are not captured by any other group.

Build mode for the TypeScript compiler:

- If `true`, the plugin will use [`tsc -b`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/project-references.html#build-mode-for-typescript) to build the project and all referenced projects before emitting `.d.ts` files.
- If `false`, the plugin will use [`tsc`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html) to emit `.d.ts` files without building referenced projects.

incremental.description:
If your tsconfig.json has [`references`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#references) option, `rolldown-plugin-dts` will use [`tsc
-b`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/project-references.html#build-mode-for-typescript) to build the project and all referenced projects before emitting `.d.ts` files.

In such case, if this option is `true`, `rolldown-plugin-dts` will write down all built files into your disk, including [`.tsbuildinfo`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#tsBuildInfoFile) and other built files. This is equivalent to running `tsc -b` in your project.

Otherwise, if this option is `false`, `rolldown-plugin-dts` will write built files only into memory and leave a small footprint in your disk.

Enabling this option will decrease the build time by caching previous build results. This is helpful when you have a large project with multiple referenced projects.

By default, `incremental` is `true` if your tsconfig has [`incremental`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#incremental) or [`tsBuildInfoFile`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#tsBuildInfoFile) enabled.

This option is only used when  {@link  Options.oxc }  is `false`.
incremental.markdownDescription:
If your tsconfig.json has
[`references`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#references) option,
`rolldown-plugin-dts` will use [`tsc
-b`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/project-references.html#build-mode-for-typescript)
to build the project and all referenced projects before emitting `.d.ts`
files.

In such case, if this option is `true`, `rolldown-plugin-dts` will write
down all built files into your disk, including
[`.tsbuildinfo`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#tsBuildInfoFile)
and other built files. This is equivalent to running `tsc -b` in your
project.

Otherwise, if this option is `false`, `rolldown-plugin-dts` will write
built files only into memory and leave a small footprint in your disk.

Enabling this option will decrease the build time by caching previous build
results. This is helpful when you have a large project with multiple
referenced projects.

By default, `incremental` is `true` if your tsconfig has
[`incremental`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#incremental) or
[`tsBuildInfoFile`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig/#tsBuildInfoFile)
enabled.

This option is only used when  {@link  Options.oxc }  is
`false`.

vue.description: If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using `vue-tsc`.
vue.markdownDescription: If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using `vue-tsc`.

tsMacro.description: If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using `@ts-macro/tsc`.
tsMacro.markdownDescription: If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using `@ts-macro/tsc`.

parallel.description: If `true`, the plugin will launch a separate process for `tsc` or `vue-tsc`. This enables processing multiple projects in parallel.
parallel.markdownDescription:
If `true`, the plugin will launch a separate process for `tsc` or `vue-tsc`.
This enables processing multiple projects in parallel.

eager.description:
If `true`, the plugin will prepare all files listed in `tsconfig.json` for `tsc` or `vue-tsc`.

This is especially useful when you have a single `tsconfig.json` for multiple projects in a monorepo.
eager.markdownDescription:
If `true`, the plugin will prepare all files listed in `tsconfig.json` for `tsc` or `vue-tsc`.

This is especially useful when you have a single `tsconfig.json` for multiple projects in a monorepo.

newContext.description:
If `true`, the plugin will create a new isolated context for each build, ensuring that previously generated `.d.ts` code and caches are not reused.

By default, the plugin may reuse internal caches or incremental build artifacts to speed up repeated builds. Enabling this option forces a clean context, guaranteeing that all type definitions are generated from scratch.
newContext.markdownDescription:
If `true`, the plugin will create a new isolated context for each build,
ensuring that previously generated `.d.ts` code and caches are not reused.

By default, the plugin may reuse internal caches or incremental build artifacts
to speed up repeated builds. Enabling this option forces a clean context,
guaranteeing that all type definitions are generated from scratch.

emitJs.description:
If `true`, the plugin will emit `.d.ts` files for `.js` files as well. This is useful when you want to generate type definitions for JavaScript files with JSDoc comments.

Enabled by default when `allowJs` in compilerOptions is `true`. This option is only used when  {@link  Options.oxc }  is `false`.
emitJs.markdownDescription:
If `true`, the plugin will emit `.d.ts` files for `.js` files as well.
This is useful when you want to generate type definitions for JavaScript files with JSDoc comments.

Enabled by default when `allowJs` in compilerOptions is `true`.
This option is only used when  {@link  Options.oxc }  is
`false`.

cwd.markdownDescription: The directory in which the plugin will search for the `tsconfig.json` file.

files.description: If no `files` or `include` property is present in a `tsconfig.json`, the compiler defaults to including all files in the containing directory and subdirectories except those specified by `exclude`. When a `files` property is specified, only those files and those specified by `include` are included.
files.markdownDescription: If no `files` or `include` property is present in a `tsconfig.json`, the compiler defaults to including all files in the containing directory and subdirectories except those specified by `exclude`. When a `files` property is specified, only those files and those specified by `include` are included.

exclude.description:
Specifies a list of files to be excluded from compilation. The `exclude` property only affects the files included via the `include` property and not the `files` property.

Glob patterns require TypeScript version 2.0 or later.
exclude.markdownDescription:
Specifies a list of files to be excluded from compilation. The `exclude` property only affects the files included via the `include` property and not the `files` property.

Glob patterns require TypeScript version 2.0 or later.

include.description:
Specifies a list of glob patterns that match files to be included in compilation.

If no `files` or `include` property is present in a `tsconfig.json`, the compiler defaults to including all files in the containing directory and subdirectories except those specified by `exclude`.
include.markdownDescription:
Specifies a list of glob patterns that match files to be included in compilation.

If no `files` or `include` property is present in a `tsconfig.json`, the compiler defaults to including all files in the containing directory and subdirectories except those specified by `exclude`.

tsconfigRaw.markdownDescription: Pass a raw `tsconfig.json` object directly to the plugin.

sourcemap.markdownDescription: If `true`, the plugin will generate declaration maps (`.d.ts.map`) for `.d.ts` files.

resolver.description:
Specifies a resolver to resolve type definitions, especially for `node_modules`.

- `'oxc'`: Uses Oxc's module resolution, which is faster and more efficient.
- `'tsc'`: Uses TypeScript's native module resolution, which may be more compatible with complex setups, but slower.
resolver.markdownDescription:
Specifies a resolver to resolve type definitions, especially for `node_modules`.

- `'oxc'`: Uses Oxc's module resolution, which is faster and more efficient.
- `'tsc'`: Uses TypeScript's native module resolution, which may be more compatible with complex setups, but slower.

cjsDefault.description:
Determines how the default export is emitted.

If set to `true`, and you are only exporting a single item using `export default ...`, the output will use `export = ...` instead of the standard ES module syntax. This is useful for compatibility with CommonJS.
cjsDefault.markdownDescription:
Determines how the default export is emitted.

If set to `true`, and you are only exporting a single item using `export default ...`,
the output will use `export = ...` instead of the standard ES module syntax.
This is useful for compatibility with CommonJS.

sideEffects.description:
Indicates whether the generated `.d.ts` files have side effects.
- If set to `true`, Rolldown will treat the `.d.ts` files as having side effects during tree-shaking.
- If set to `false`, Rolldown may consider the `.d.ts` files as side-effect-free, potentially removing them if they are not imported.
sideEffects.markdownDescription:
Indicates whether the generated `.d.ts` files have side effects.
- If set to `true`, Rolldown will treat the `.d.ts` files as having side effects during tree-shaking.
- If set to `false`, Rolldown may consider the `.d.ts` files as side-effect-free, potentially removing them if they are not imported.

oxc.description:
If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using Oxc, which is significantly faster than the TypeScript compiler.

This option is automatically enabled when `isolatedDeclarations` in `compilerOptions` is set to `true`.
oxc.markdownDescription:
If `true`, the plugin will generate `.d.ts` files using Oxc,
which is significantly faster than the TypeScript compiler.

This option is automatically enabled when `isolatedDeclarations` in `compilerOptions` is set to `true`.

tsgo.description:
**[Experimental]** Enables DTS generation using `tsgo`.

To use this option, make sure `@typescript/native-preview` is installed as a dependency.

**Note:** This option is not yet recommended for production environments. `tsconfigRaw` and `isolatedDeclarations` options will be ignored when this option is enabled.

dts.description:
Enables generation of TypeScript declaration files (`.d.ts`).

By default, this option is auto-detected based on your project's `package.json`:
- If the `types` field is present, or if the main `exports` contains a `types` entry, declaration file generation is enabled by default.
- Otherwise, declaration file generation is disabled by default.

- Otherwise, declaration file generation is disabled by default.

pkgDir.description:
Path to your package that contains a package.json file.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `process.cwd()`.
- **Browser**: Automatically inferred from `{ tarball: ArrayBuffer | ReadableStream }`. If `{ files: PackFile[] }` is used,                this must be the shared directory of all files in `files`. e.g. if `name` has `"package/src/index.js",                the `pkgDir` should be `"package"`. :::

level.description:
The level of messages to log (default: `'suggestion'`).
- `suggestion`: logs all messages
- `warning`: logs only `warning` and `error` messages
- `error`: logs only `error` messages
level.markdownDescription:
The level of messages to log (default: `'suggestion'`).
- `suggestion`: logs all messages
- `warning`: logs only `warning` and `error` messages
- `error`: logs only `error` messages

pack.description:
The package manager to use for packing the `pkgDir`. The list of packed files is used in certain linting rules, e.g. files marked as entrypoints but not published.
- `'auto'`: Automatically detects the package manager using             [`package-manager-detector`](https://github.com/antfu-collective/package-manager-detector).
- `'npm'`/`'yarn'`/`'pnpm'`/`'bun'`: Uses the respective package manager to pack.
- `{ tarball }`: The packed tarball represented as an `ArrayBuffer` or a `ReadableStream`.
- `{ files }`: The manually-unpacked files from a tarball.
- `false`: Skips packing the package. This should only be used if all the files            in `pkgDir` are assumed to be published, e.g. in `node_modules`.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `'auto'`. All options above are supported. When using a package manager                to pack, lifecycle scripts like `prepack` and `postpack` are ignored                (except for yarn as it does not allow ignoring lifecycle scripts).
- **Browser**: Only `{ tarball }` and `{ files }` are supported and either **must be passed** to work,                as the browser does not have access to the file system. :::
pack.markdownDescription:
The package manager to use for packing the `pkgDir`. The list of
packed files is used in certain linting rules, e.g. files marked as
entrypoints but not published.
- `'auto'`: Automatically detects the package manager using
            [`package-manager-detector`](https://github.com/antfu-collective/package-manager-detector).
- `'npm'`/`'yarn'`/`'pnpm'`/`'bun'`: Uses the respective package manager to pack.
- `{ tarball }`: The packed tarball represented as an `ArrayBuffer` or a `ReadableStream`.
- `{ files }`: The manually-unpacked files from a tarball.
- `false`: Skips packing the package. This should only be used if all the files
           in `pkgDir` are assumed to be published, e.g. in `node_modules`.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `'auto'`. All options above are supported. When using a package manager
               to pack, lifecycle scripts like `prepack` and `postpack` are ignored
               (except for yarn as it does not allow ignoring lifecycle scripts).
- **Browser**: Only `{ tarball }` and `{ files }` are supported and either **must be passed** to work,
               as the browser does not have access to the file system.
:::

name.description:
The name is what your thing is called. Some rules:
- The name must be less than or equal to 214 characters. This includes the scope for scoped packages.
- The name cant start with a dot or an underscore.
- New packages must not have uppercase letters in the name.
- The name ends up being part of a URL, an argument on the command line, and a folder name. Therefore, the name cant contain any non-URL-safe characters.

The name is what your thing is called.
Some rules:
- The name must be less than or equal to 214 characters. This includes the scope for scoped packages.
- The name cant start with a dot or an underscore.
- New packages must not have uppercase letters in the name.
- The name ends up being part of a URL, an argument on the command line, and a folder name. Therefore, the name cant contain any non-URL-safe characters.

files.description: The optional `files` field is an array of file patterns that describes the entries to be included when your package is installed as a dependency. File patterns follow a similar syntax to `.gitignore`, but reversed: including a file, directory, or glob pattern (`*`, `**\/*`, and such) will make it so that file is included in the tarball when its packed. Omitting the field will make it default to `["*"]`, which means it will include all files.
files.markdownDescription: The optional `files` field is an array of file patterns that describes the entries to be included when your package is installed as a dependency. File patterns follow a similar syntax to `.gitignore`, but reversed: including a file, directory, or glob pattern (`*`, `**\/*`, and such) will make it so that file is included in the tarball when its packed. Omitting the field will make it default to `["*"]`, which means it will include all files.

main.description: The main field is a module ID that is the primary entry point to your program. That is, if your package is named `foo`, and a user installs it, and then does `require("foo")`, then your main modules exports object will be returned. This should be a module ID relative to the root of your package folder. For most modules, it makes the most sense to have a main script and often not much else.
main.markdownDescription:
The main field is a module ID that is the primary entry point to your program. That is, if your package is named `foo`, and a user installs it, and then does `require("foo")`, then your main modules exports object will be returned.

os.description: You can specify which operating systems your module will run on: ```json {   "os": ["darwin", "linux"] } ``` You can also block instead of allowing operating systems, just prepend the blocked os with a '!': ```json {   "os": ["!win32"] } ``` The host operating system is determined by `process.platform` It is allowed to both block and allow an item, although there isn't any good reason to do this.

name.description:
The name is what your thing is called. Some rules:
- The name must be less than or equal to 214 characters. This includes the scope for scoped packages.
- The name cant start with a dot or an underscore.
- New packages must not have uppercase letters in the name.
- The name ends up being part of a URL, an argument on the command line, and a folder name. Therefore, the name cant contain any non-URL-safe characters.

The name is what your thing is called.

- The name cant start with a dot or an underscore.
- New packages must not have uppercase letters in the name.
- The name ends up being part of a URL, an argument on the command line, and a folder name. Therefore, the name cant contain any non-URL-safe characters.

files.description: The optional `files` field is an array of file patterns that describes the entries to be included when your package is installed as a dependency. File patterns follow a similar syntax to `.gitignore`, but reversed: including a file, directory, or glob pattern (`*`, `**\/*`, and such) will make it so that file is included in the tarball when its packed. Omitting the field will make it default to `["*"]`, which means it will include all files.

main.description: The main field is a module ID that is the primary entry point to your program. That is, if your package is named `foo`, and a user installs it, and then does `require("foo")`, then your main modules exports object will be returned. jsx.description: Specify what JSX code is generated.

reactNamespace.description: Specifies the object invoked for `createElement` and `__spread` when targeting `'react'` JSX emit.
reactNamespace.markdownDescription: Specifies the object invoked for `createElement` and `__spread` when targeting `'react'` JSX emit.

jsxFactory.description: Specify the JSX factory function to use when targeting React JSX emit, e.g. `React.createElement` or `h`.
jsxFactory.markdownDescription: Specify the JSX factory function to use when targeting React JSX emit, e.g. `React.createElement` or `h`.

jsxFragmentFactory.description: Specify the JSX Fragment reference used for fragments when targeting React JSX emit e.g. 'React.Fragment' or 'Fragment'.
jsxFragmentFactory.markdownDescription: Specify the JSX Fragment reference used for fragments when targeting React JSX emit e.g. 'React.Fragment' or 'Fragment'.

jsxImportSource.description: Specify module specifier used to import the JSX factory functions when using `jsx: react-jsx*`.
jsxImportSource.markdownDescription: Specify module specifier used to import the JSX factory functions when using `jsx: react-jsx*`.

listFiles.description: Print names of files part of the compilation.
listFiles.markdownDescription: Print names of files part of the compilation.

mapRoot.description: Specifies the location where debugger should locate map files instead of generated locations.
mapRoot.markdownDescription: Specifies the location where debugger should locate map files instead of generated locations.

module.description: Specify module code generation: 'None', 'CommonJS', 'AMD', 'System', 'UMD', 'ES6', 'ES2015' or 'ESNext'. Only 'AMD' and 'System' can be used in conjunction with `--outFile`. 'ES6' and 'ES2015' values may be used when targeting 'ES5' or lower.
module.markdownDescription: Specify module code generation: 'None', 'CommonJS', 'AMD', 'System', 'UMD', 'ES6', 'ES2015' or 'ESNext'. Only 'AMD' and 'System' can be used in conjunction with `--outFile`. 'ES6' and 'ES2015' values may be used when targeting 'ES5' or lower.

moduleResolution.description: Specifies module resolution strategy: 'node' (Node) or 'classic' (TypeScript pre 1.6).
moduleResolution.markdownDescription: Specifies module resolution strategy: 'node' (Node) or 'classic' (TypeScript pre 1.6).

newLine.description: Specifies the end of line sequence to be used when emitting files: 'crlf' (Windows) or 'lf' (Unix).
newLine.markdownDescription: Specifies the end of line sequence to be used when emitting files: 'crlf' (Windows) or 'lf' (Unix).

noCheck.description: Disable full type checking (only critical parse and emit errors will be reported).
noCheck.markdownDescription: Disable full type checking (only critical parse and emit errors will be reported).

noEmitHelpers.description: Do not generate custom helper functions like `__extends` in compiled output.
noEmitHelpers.markdownDescription: Do not generate custom helper functions like `__extends` in compiled output.

noEmitOnError.description: Do not emit outputs if any type checking errors were reported.
noEmitOnError.markdownDescription: Do not emit outputs if any type checking errors were reported.

noImplicitAny.description: Warn on expressions and declarations with an implied 'any' type.
noImplicitAny.markdownDescription: Warn on expressions and declarations with an implied 'any' type.

noImplicitThis.description: Raise error on 'this' expressions with an implied any type.
noImplicitThis.markdownDescription: Raise error on 'this' expressions with an implied any type.

noLib.description: Do not include the default library file (lib.d.ts).
noLib.markdownDescription: Do not include the default library file (lib.d.ts).

noResolve.description: Do not add triple-slash references or module import targets to the list of compiled files.
noResolve.markdownDescription: Do not add triple-slash references or module import targets to the list of compiled files.

noStrictGenericChecks.description: Disable strict checking of generic signatures in function types.
noStrictGenericChecks.markdownDescription: Disable strict checking of generic signatures in function types.
noStrictGenericChecks.deprecated: This option will be removed in TypeScript 5.5.

skipLibCheck.description: Skip type checking of declaration files.
skipLibCheck.markdownDescription: Skip type checking of declaration files.

outFile.description: Concatenate and emit output to single file.
outFile.markdownDescription: Concatenate and emit output to single file.

outDir.description: Redirect output structure to the directory.
outDir.markdownDescription: Redirect output structure to the directory.

preserveConstEnums.description: Do not erase const enum declarations in generated code.
preserveConstEnums.markdownDescription: Do not erase const enum declarations in generated code.

preserveSymlinks.description: Do not resolve symlinks to their real path; treat a symlinked file like a real one.
preserveSymlinks.markdownDescription: Do not resolve symlinks to their real path; treat a symlinked file like a real one.

preserveWatchOutput.description: Keep outdated console output in watch mode instead of clearing the screen.
preserveWatchOutput.markdownDescription: Keep outdated console output in watch mode instead of clearing the screen.

pretty.description: Stylize errors and messages using color and context (experimental).
pretty.markdownDescription: Stylize errors and messages using color and context (experimental).

removeComments.description: Do not emit comments to output.
removeComments.markdownDescription: Do not emit comments to output.

rewriteRelativeImportExtensions.description: Rewrite '.ts', '.tsx', '.mts', and '.cts' file extensions in relative import paths to their JavaScript equivalent in output files.
rewriteRelativeImportExtensions.markdownDescription: Rewrite '.ts', '.tsx', '.mts', and '.cts' file extensions in relative import paths to their JavaScript equivalent in output files.

rootDir.description:
Specifies the root directory of input files.

Use to control the output directory structure with `--outDir`.
rootDir.markdownDescription:
Specifies the root directory of input files.

Use to control the output directory structure with `--outDir`.

isolatedModules.description: Unconditionally emit imports for unresolved files.
isolatedModules.markdownDescription: Unconditionally emit imports for unresolved files.

isolatedDeclarations.description: Require sufficient annotation on exports so other tools can trivially generate declaration files.
isolatedDeclarations.markdownDescription: Require sufficient annotation on exports so other tools can trivially generate declaration files.

sourceRoot.description: Specifies the location where debugger should locate TypeScript files instead of source locations.
sourceRoot.markdownDescription: Specifies the location where debugger should locate TypeScript files instead of source locations.

suppressExcessPropertyErrors.description: Suppress excess property checks for object literals.
suppressExcessPropertyErrors.markdownDescription: Suppress excess property checks for object literals.
suppressExcessPropertyErrors.deprecated: This option will be removed in TypeScript 5.5.

suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors.description: Suppress noImplicitAny errors for indexing objects lacking index signatures.
suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors.markdownDescription: Suppress noImplicitAny errors for indexing objects lacking index signatures.
suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors.deprecated: This option will be removed in TypeScript 5.5.

stripInternal.description: Do not emit declarations for code that has an `@internal` annotation.
stripInternal.markdownDescription: Do not emit declarations for code that has an `@internal` annotation.

useUnknownInCatchVariables.description: Default catch clause variables as `unknown` instead of `any`.
useUnknownInCatchVariables.markdownDescription: Default catch clause variables as `unknown` instead of `any`.

fallbackPolling.description: Specify the polling strategy to use when the system runs out of or doesn't support native file watchers.
fallbackPolling.markdownDescription: Specify the polling strategy to use when the system runs out of or doesn't support native file watchers.

watchDirectory.description: Specify the strategy for watching directories under systems that lack recursive file-watching functionality.
watchDirectory.markdownDescription: Specify the strategy for watching directories under systems that lack recursive file-watching functionality.

watchFile.description: Specify the strategy for watching individual files.
watchFile.markdownDescription: Specify the strategy for watching individual files.

experimentalDecorators.description: Enables experimental support for ES7 decorators.
experimentalDecorators.markdownDescription: Enables experimental support for ES7 decorators.

emitDecoratorMetadata.description: Emit design-type metadata for decorated declarations in source.
emitDecoratorMetadata.markdownDescription: Emit design-type metadata for decorated declarations in source.

allowUnusedLabels.description: Do not report errors on unused labels.
allowUnusedLabels.markdownDescription: Do not report errors on unused labels.

noImplicitReturns.description: Report error when not all code paths in function return a value.
noImplicitReturns.markdownDescription: Report error when not all code paths in function return a value.

noUncheckedIndexedAccess.description: Add `undefined` to a type when accessed using an index.
noUncheckedIndexedAccess.markdownDescription: Add `undefined` to a type when accessed using an index.

noUncheckedSideEffectImports.description: Report error if failed to find a source file for a side effect import.
noUncheckedSideEffectImports.markdownDescription: Report error if failed to find a source file for a side effect import.

noFallthroughCasesInSwitch.description: Report errors for fallthrough cases in switch statement.
noFallthroughCasesInSwitch.markdownDescription: Report errors for fallthrough cases in switch statement.

noImplicitOverride.description: Ensure overriding members in derived classes are marked with an override modifier.
noImplicitOverride.markdownDescription: Ensure overriding members in derived classes are marked with an override modifier.

allowUnreachableCode.description: Do not report errors on unreachable code.
allowUnreachableCode.markdownDescription: Do not report errors on unreachable code.

forceConsistentCasingInFileNames.description: Disallow inconsistently-cased references to the same file.
forceConsistentCasingInFileNames.markdownDescription: Disallow inconsistently-cased references to the same file.

generateCpuProfile.description: Emit a v8 CPU profile of the compiler run for debugging.
generateCpuProfile.markdownDescription: Emit a v8 CPU profile of the compiler run for debugging.

generateTrace.description: Generates an event trace and a list of types.
generateTrace.markdownDescription: Generates an event trace and a list of types.

baseUrl.description: Base directory to resolve non-relative module names.
baseUrl.markdownDescription: Base directory to resolve non-relative module names.

paths.description: Specify path mapping to be computed relative to baseUrl option.
paths.markdownDescription: Specify path mapping to be computed relative to baseUrl option.

plugins.description: List of TypeScript language server plugins to load.
plugins.markdownDescription: List of TypeScript language server plugins to load.

rootDirs.description: Specify list of root directories to be used when resolving modules.
rootDirs.markdownDescription: Specify list of root directories to be used when resolving modules.

typeRoots.description: Specify list of directories for type definition files to be included.
typeRoots.markdownDescription: Specify list of directories for type definition files to be included.

types.description: Type declaration files to be included in compilation.
types.markdownDescription: Type declaration files to be included in compilation.

traceResolution.description: Enable tracing of the name resolution process.
traceResolution.markdownDescription: Enable tracing of the name resolution process.

allowJs.description: Allow javascript files to be compiled.
allowJs.markdownDescription: Allow javascript files to be compiled.

allowSyntheticDefaultImports.description: Allow default imports from modules with no default export. This does not affect code emit, just typechecking.
allowSyntheticDefaultImports.markdownDescription: Allow default imports from modules with no default export. This does not affect code emit, just typechecking.

noImplicitUseStrict.description: Do not emit `'use strict'` directives in module output.
noImplicitUseStrict.markdownDescription: Do not emit `'use strict'` directives in module output.
noImplicitUseStrict.deprecated: This option will be removed in TypeScript 5.5.

listEmittedFiles.description: Enable to list all emitted files.
listEmittedFiles.markdownDescription: Enable to list all emitted files.

disableSizeLimit.description: Disable size limit for JavaScript project.
disableSizeLimit.markdownDescription: Disable size limit for JavaScript project.

lib.description: List of library files to be included in the compilation.
lib.markdownDescription: List of library files to be included in the compilation.

maxNodeModuleJsDepth.description: The maximum dependency depth to search under `node_modules` and load JavaScript files. Only applicable with `--allowJs`.
maxNodeModuleJsDepth.markdownDescription: The maximum dependency depth to search under `node_modules` and load JavaScript files. Only applicable with `--allowJs`.

importHelpers.description: Import emit helpers (e.g. `__extends`, `__rest`, etc..) from tslib.
importHelpers.markdownDescription: Import emit helpers (e.g. `__extends`, `__rest`, etc..) from tslib.

importsNotUsedAsValues.description: Specify emit/checking behavior for imports that are only used for types.
importsNotUsedAsValues.markdownDescription: Specify emit/checking behavior for imports that are only used for types.

alwaysStrict.description: Parse in strict mode and emit `'use strict'` for each source file.
alwaysStrict.markdownDescription: Parse in strict mode and emit `'use strict'` for each source file.

strict.description: Enable all strict type checking options.
strict.markdownDescription: Enable all strict type checking options.

strictBindCallApply.description: Enable stricter checking of of the `bind`, `call`, and `apply` methods on functions.
strictBindCallApply.markdownDescription: Enable stricter checking of of the `bind`, `call`, and `apply` methods on functions.

downlevelIteration.description: Provide full support for iterables in `for-of`, spread, and destructuring when targeting `ES5` or `ES3`.
downlevelIteration.markdownDescription: Provide full support for iterables in `for-of`, spread, and destructuring when targeting `ES5` or `ES3`.

strictBuiltinIteratorReturn.description: Built-in iterators are instantiated with a `TReturn` type of undefined instead of `any`.
strictBuiltinIteratorReturn.markdownDescription: Built-in iterators are instantiated with a `TReturn` type of undefined instead of `any`.

strictFunctionTypes.description: Disable bivariant parameter checking for function types.
strictFunctionTypes.markdownDescription: Disable bivariant parameter checking for function types.

strictPropertyInitialization.description: Ensure non-undefined class properties are initialized in the constructor.
strictPropertyInitialization.markdownDescription: Ensure non-undefined class properties are initialized in the constructor.

esModuleInterop.description: Emit `__importStar` and `__importDefault` helpers for runtime Babel ecosystem compatibility and enable `--allowSyntheticDefaultImports` for typesystem compatibility.
esModuleInterop.markdownDescription: Emit `__importStar` and `__importDefault` helpers for runtime Babel ecosystem compatibility and enable `--allowSyntheticDefaultImports` for typesystem compatibility.

allowUmdGlobalAccess.description: Allow accessing UMD globals from modules.
allowUmdGlobalAccess.markdownDescription: Allow accessing UMD globals from modules.

keyofStringsOnly.description: Resolve `keyof` to string valued property names only (no numbers or symbols).
keyofStringsOnly.markdownDescription: Resolve `keyof` to string valued property names only (no numbers or symbols).
keyofStringsOnly.deprecated: This option will be removed in TypeScript 5.5.

declarationMap.description: Generates a sourcemap for each corresponding `.d.ts` file.
declarationMap.markdownDescription: Generates a sourcemap for each corresponding `.d.ts` file.

assumeChangesOnlyAffectDirectDependencie.description: Have recompiles in '--incremental' and '--watch' assume that changes within a file will only affect files directly depending on it.
assumeChangesOnlyAffectDirectDependencie.markdownDescription: Have recompiles in '--incremental' and '--watch' assume that changes within a file will only affect files directly depending on it.

extendedDiagnostics.description: Output more detailed compiler performance information after building.
extendedDiagnostics.markdownDescription: Output more detailed compiler performance information after building.

listFilesOnly.description: Print names of files that are part of the compilation and then stop processing.
listFilesOnly.markdownDescription: Print names of files that are part of the compilation and then stop processing.

disableSourceOfProjectReferenceRedirect.description: Disable preferring source files instead of declaration files when referencing composite projects.
disableSourceOfProjectReferenceRedirect.markdownDescription: Disable preferring source files instead of declaration files when referencing composite projects.

disableSolutionSearching.description: Opt a project out of multi-project reference checking when editing.
disableSolutionSearching.markdownDescription: Opt a project out of multi-project reference checking when editing.

explainFiles.description: Print names of files which TypeScript sees as a part of your project and the reason they are part of the compilation.
explainFiles.markdownDescription: Print names of files which TypeScript sees as a part of your project and the reason they are part of the compilation.

preserveValueImports.description: Preserve unused imported values in the JavaScript output that would otherwise be removed.
preserveValueImports.markdownDescription: Preserve unused imported values in the JavaScript output that would otherwise be removed.

moduleSuffixes.description: List of file name suffixes to search when resolving a module.
moduleSuffixes.markdownDescription: List of file name suffixes to search when resolving a module.

moduleDetection.description: Control what method is used to detect module-format JS files.
moduleDetection.markdownDescription: Control what method is used to detect module-format JS files.

allowImportingTsExtensions.description: Allows TypeScript files to import each other with a TypeScript-specific extension like .ts, .mts, or .tsx.
allowImportingTsExtensions.markdownDescription: Allows TypeScript files to import each other with a TypeScript-specific extension like .ts, .mts, or .tsx.

resolvePackageJsonExports.description: Forces TypeScript to consult the exports field of package.json files if it ever reads from a package in node_modules.
resolvePackageJsonExports.markdownDescription: Forces TypeScript to consult the exports field of package.json files if it ever reads from a package in node_modules.

resolvePackageJsonImports.description: Forces TypeScript to consult the imports field of package.json files when performing a lookup that starts with # from a file whose ancestor directory contains a package.json.
resolvePackageJsonImports.markdownDescription: Forces TypeScript to consult the imports field of package.json files when performing a lookup that starts with # from a file whose ancestor directory contains a package.json.

allowArbitraryExtensions.description: Suppress errors for file formats that TypeScript does not understand.
allowArbitraryExtensions.markdownDescription: Suppress errors for file formats that TypeScript does not understand.

customConditions.description: List of additional conditions that should succeed when TypeScript resolves from package.json.
customConditions.markdownDescription: List of additional conditions that should succeed when TypeScript resolves from package.json.

verbatimModuleSyntax.description: Anything that uses the type modifier is dropped entirely.
verbatimModuleSyntax.markdownDescription: Anything that uses the type modifier is dropped entirely.

erasableSyntaxOnly.description: Do not allow runtime constructs that are not part of ECMAScript.
erasableSyntaxOnly.markdownDescription: Do not allow runtime constructs that are not part of ECMAScript.

gzip.description: Enable/disable gzip-compressed size reporting. Compressing large output files can be slow, so disabling this may increase build performance for large projects.
gzip.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable gzip-compressed size reporting.
Compressing large output files can be slow, so disabling this may increase build performance for large projects.

brotli.description: Enable/disable brotli-compressed size reporting. Compressing large output files can be slow, so disabling this may increase build performance for large projects.
brotli.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable brotli-compressed size reporting.
Compressing large output files can be slow, so disabling this may increase build performance for large projects.

maxCompressSize.description: Skip reporting compressed size for files larger than this size.
maxCompressSize.markdownDescription: Skip reporting compressed size for files larger than this size.

devExports.description:
Generate exports that link to source code during development.
- string: add as a custom condition.
- true: all conditions point to source files, and add dist exports to `publishConfig`.
devExports.markdownDescription:
Generate exports that link to source code during development.
- string: add as a custom condition.
- true: all conditions point to source files, and add dist exports to `publishConfig`.

exclude.description:
Specifies file patterns (as glob patterns or regular expressions) to exclude from package exports. Use this to prevent certain files from being included in the exported package, such as test files, binaries, or internal utilities.

**Note:** Do not include file extensions, and paths should be relative to the dist directory.
exclude.markdownDescription:
Specifies file patterns (as glob patterns or regular expressions) to exclude from package exports.
Use this to prevent certain files from being included in the exported package, such as test files, binaries, or internal utilities.

**Note:** Do not include file extensions, and paths should be relative to the dist directory.

legacy.description:
Generate legacy fields (`main` and `module`) for older Node.js and bundlers that do not support package `exports` field.

Defaults to false, if only ESM builds are included, true otherwise.
legacy.markdownDescription:
Generate legacy fields (`main` and `module`) for older Node.js and bundlers
that do not support package `exports` field.

Defaults to false, if only ESM builds are included, true otherwise.

ui.description:
**[experimental]** Enable devtools integration. `@vitejs/devtools` must be installed as a dependency.

Defaults to true, if `@vitejs/devtools` is installed.
ui.markdownDescription:
**[experimental]** Enable devtools integration. `@vitejs/devtools` must be installed as a dependency.

Defaults to true, if `@vitejs/devtools` is installed.

pkgDir.description:
Path to your package that contains a package.json file.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `process.cwd()`.
- **Browser**: Automatically inferred from `{ tarball: ArrayBuffer | ReadableStream }`. If `{ files: PackFile[] }` is used,                this must be the shared directory of all files in `files`. e.g. if `name` has `"package/src/index.js",                the `pkgDir` should be `"package"`. :::
pkgDir.markdownDescription:
Path to your package that contains a package.json file.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `process.cwd()`.
- **Browser**: Automatically inferred from `{ tarball: ArrayBuffer | ReadableStream }`. If `{ files: PackFile[] }` is used,
               this must be the shared directory of all files in `files`. e.g. if `name` has `"package/src/index.js",
               the `pkgDir` should be `"package"`.
:::

level.description:
The level of messages to log (default: `'suggestion'`).
- `suggestion`: logs all messages
- `warning`: logs only `warning` and `error` messages
- `error`: logs only `error` messages
level.markdownDescription:
The level of messages to log (default: `'suggestion'`).
- `suggestion`: logs all messages
- `warning`: logs only `warning` and `error` messages
- `error`: logs only `error` messages

pack.description:
The package manager to use for packing the `pkgDir`. The list of packed files is used in certain linting rules, e.g. files marked as entrypoints but not published.
- `'auto'`: Automatically detects the package manager using             [`package-manager-detector`](https://github.com/antfu-collective/package-manager-detector).
- `'npm'`/`'yarn'`/`'pnpm'`/`'bun'`: Uses the respective package manager to pack.
- `{ tarball }`: The packed tarball represented as an `ArrayBuffer` or a `ReadableStream`.
- `{ files }`: The manually-unpacked files from a tarball.
- `false`: Skips packing the package. This should only be used if all the files            in `pkgDir` are assumed to be published, e.g. in `node_modules`.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `'auto'`. All options above are supported. When using a package manager                to pack, lifecycle scripts like `prepack` and `postpack` are ignored                (except for yarn as it does not allow ignoring lifecycle scripts).
- **Browser**: Only `{ tarball }` and `{ files }` are supported and either **must be passed** to work,                as the browser does not have access to the file system. :::
pack.markdownDescription:
The package manager to use for packing the `pkgDir`. The list of
packed files is used in certain linting rules, e.g. files marked as
entrypoints but not published.
- `'auto'`: Automatically detects the package manager using
            [`package-manager-detector`](https://github.com/antfu-collective/package-manager-detector).
- `'npm'`/`'yarn'`/`'pnpm'`/`'bun'`: Uses the respective package manager to pack.
- `{ tarball }`: The packed tarball represented as an `ArrayBuffer` or a `ReadableStream`.
- `{ files }`: The manually-unpacked files from a tarball.
- `false`: Skips packing the package. This should only be used if all the files
           in `pkgDir` are assumed to be published, e.g. in `node_modules`.

::: info Environment notes
- **Node.js**: Defaults to `'auto'`. All options above are supported. When using a package manager
               to pack, lifecycle scripts like `prepack` and `postpack` are ignored
               (except for yarn as it does not allow ignoring lifecycle scripts).
- **Browser**: Only `{ tarball }` and `{ files }` are supported and either **must be passed** to work,
               as the browser does not have access to the file system.
:::

entrypoints.description: Exhaustive list of entrypoints to check. The package root is `"."`. Specifying this option disables automatic entrypoint discovery, and overrides the `includeEntrypoints` and `excludeEntrypoints` options.
entrypoints.markdownDescription:
Exhaustive list of entrypoints to check. The package root is `"."`.
Specifying this option disables automatic entrypoint discovery,
and overrides the `includeEntrypoints` and `excludeEntrypoints` options.

includeEntrypoints.description: Entrypoints to check in addition to automatically discovered ones.
includeEntrypoints.markdownDescription: Entrypoints to check in addition to automatically discovered ones.

entrypointsLegacy.description: Whether to automatically consider all published files as entrypoints in the absence of any other detected or configured entrypoints.
entrypointsLegacy.markdownDescription:
Whether to automatically consider all published files as entrypoints
in the absence of any other detected or configured entrypoints.

profile.description:
Profiles select a set of resolution modes to require/ignore. All are evaluated but failures outside of those required are ignored.

The available profiles are:
- `strict`: requires all resolutions
- `node16`: ignores node10 resolution failures
- `esm-only`: ignores CJS resolution failures
profile.markdownDescription:
Profiles select a set of resolution modes to require/ignore. All are evaluated but failures outside
of those required are ignored.

The available profiles are:
- `strict`: requires all resolutions
- `node16`: ignores node10 resolution failures
- `esm-only`: ignores CJS resolution failures

level.description:
The level of the check.

The available levels are:
- `error`: fails the build
- `warn`: warns the build
level.markdownDescription:
The level of the check.

The available levels are:
- `error`: fails the build
- `warn`: warns the build

ignoreRules.description:
List of problem types to ignore by rule name.

The available values are:
- `no-resolution`
- `untyped-resolution`
- `false-cjs`
- `false-esm`
- `cjs-resolves-to-esm`
- `fallback-condition`
- `cjs-only-exports-default`
- `named-exports`
- `false-export-default`
- `missing-export-equals`
- `unexpected-module-syntax`
- `internal-resolution-error`
ignoreRules.markdownDescription:
List of problem types to ignore by rule name.

The available values are:
- `no-resolution`
- `untyped-resolution`
- `false-cjs`
- `false-esm`
- `cjs-resolves-to-esm`
- `fallback-condition`
- `cjs-only-exports-default`
- `named-exports`
- `false-export-default`
- `missing-export-equals`
- `unexpected-module-syntax`
- `internal-resolution-error`

enforce.description: Vite-specific option to control plugin ordering
enforce.markdownDescription: Vite-specific option to control plugin ordering

splitting.description: Enable/disable CSS code splitting. When set to `false`, all CSS in the entire project will be extracted into a single CSS file. When set to `true`, CSS imported in async JS chunks will be preserved as chunks.
splitting.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable CSS code splitting.
When set to `false`, all CSS in the entire project will be extracted into a single CSS file.
When set to `true`, CSS imported in async JS chunks will be preserved as chunks.

fileName.description: Specify the name of the CSS file.
fileName.markdownDescription: Specify the name of the CSS file.

to.description: Destination path. If not specified, defaults to the output directory ("outDir").
to.markdownDescription:
Destination path.
If not specified, defaults to the output directory ("outDir").

flatten.description: Whether to flatten the copied files (not preserving directory structure).
flatten.markdownDescription: Whether to flatten the copied files (not preserving directory structure).

rename.description: Change destination file or folder name.
rename.markdownDescription: Change destination file or folder name.

include.description:
Workspace directories. Glob patterns are supported.
- `auto`: Automatically detect `package.json` files in the workspace.
include.markdownDescription:
Workspace directories. Glob patterns are supported.
- `auto`: Automatically detect `package.json` files in the workspace.

exclude.description: Exclude directories from workspace. Defaults to all `node_modules`, `dist`, `test`, `tests`, `temp`, and `tmp` directories.
exclude.markdownDescription:
Exclude directories from workspace.
Defaults to all `node_modules`, `dist`, `test`, `tests`, `temp`, and `tmp` directories.

config.description: Path to the workspace configuration file.
config.markdownDescription: Path to the workspace configuration file.
